titleStmt.title: The seconde book of Tertullian vnto his wyf, translated into Englyshe, wherei[n] is co[n]teined most godly cou[n]sel how those that be vnmaryed, may chose vnto them selfes godly companyons, and so to liue quyetly in this world and blessedlye in the worlde to come
Ad uxorem. Book 2. English
titleStmt.author: Tertullian, ca. 160-ca. 230.
Hooper, John, d. 1555.
Rhenanus, Beatus, 1485-1547. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: By [N. Hill for] Richarde Jugge, dwellynge in Paules churche yarde at the sygne of the Byble,

notesStmt.note: A translation, by John Hooper, of Book 2 of: Tertullian. Ad uxorem.
Imprint from colophon; printer's name from STC.

Includes: "A letter directed, vnto a certayne godlye and vertuous wyddowe of London, wrytten by the husband of a daughter of hers." and "The prologe and argumente, of this booke, made in Latin by maister beatus Rhenamus, [..]".
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
